intro: Polygonum pringlei, commonly known as Pringle's knotweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants characterized by their distinctive swollen nodes along the stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that have a rough, textured surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late summer. Polygonum pringlei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
